Package v1

Class Notebook

java.lang.Object
v1.Notebook
public class Notebook
extends java.lang.Object
The class Notebook represents a notebook that is comprised of notes, where the user can add, remove, and move notes.
Version:
February 2nd, 2021
Author:
Sarah Pham

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> notes
    A collection of notes, like a notebook.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Notebook()
    Creates a notebook.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addNote​(java.lang.String note)
    Adds the user-entered note to the notebook.
    void deleteNote​(int index)
    Deletes the note depending on the position the user enters.
    java.lang.String getNote​(int index)
    Returns the note for the user-entered position.
    int getNoteNumber​(java.lang.String note)
    Returns the position of the user-entered note.
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getNotes()
    Returns the ArrayList of notes.
    void moveNoteDown​(java.lang.String note)
    Moves a user-entered note down one position.
    void moveNoteToBottom​(java.lang.String note)
    Moves a user-entered note to the bottom position in the notebook.
    void moveNoteToTop​(java.lang.String note)
    Moves a user-entered note to the first position in the notebook.
    void moveNoteUp​(java.lang.String note)
    Moves a user-entered note up one position.
    int numberOfNotes()
    Returns the number of notes in the notebook.
    void setNote​(int index, java.lang.String note)
    Replaces an already-existing note with the user-entered text at a user-entered position.
    void setNotes​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> notes)
    Sets the user-entered ArrayList as the notes in the notebook if it is not null.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • getNotes

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getNotes()
      Returns the ArrayList of notes.
      Returns:
      The ArrayList of notes.

    • setNotes

      public void setNotes​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> notes)
      Sets the user-entered ArrayList as the notes in the notebook if it is not null.
      Parameters:
      notes - The ArrayList the user wants to put in the notebook.

    • numberOfNotes

      public int numberOfNotes()
      Returns the number of notes in the notebook.
      Returns:
      The number of notes.

    • addNote

      public void addNote​(java.lang.String note)
      Adds the user-entered note to the notebook.
      Parameters:
      note - The note the user wants to add.

    • deleteNote

      public void deleteNote​(int index)
      Deletes the note depending on the position the user enters.
      Parameters:
      index - The position of the note that the user wants to delete.

    • getNoteNumber

      public int getNoteNumber​(java.lang.String note)
      Returns the position of the user-entered note.
      Parameters:
      note - The note the user wants to find the position of.
      Returns:
      The position of the user-entered note.

    • getNote

      public java.lang.String getNote​(int index)
      Returns the note for the user-entered position.
      Parameters:
      index - The position the user wants to get the note of.
      Returns:
      The note at the user-entered position.

    • setNote

      public void setNote​(int index, java.lang.String note)
      Replaces an already-existing note with the user-entered text at a user-entered position.
      Parameters:
      index - The position of the note the user wants to replace.
      note - The note the user wants to replace the current one with.

    • moveNoteUp

      public void moveNoteUp​(java.lang.String note)
      Moves a user-entered note up one position. TEST
      Parameters:
      note - The note the user wants to move up one position.

      note - The note the user wants to move to the first position.
